Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Schema Error when order of w:b and w:i is switched inside w:rPr" (#737) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Before submitting an issue, please fill this out

Is this a:
- [x] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [ ] Question on library usage

---------------- Remove this line and above before posting ----------------

**Description**

When validating a `docx` file that has `<w:rPr>` with `<w:i/>` and `<w:b/>`, the error is thrown if `<w:i/>` appears before `<w:b/>`.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Core 3.1
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.11.0

**Repro**

```xml
            <w:r w:rsidRPr="0009578B">
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:i/>
                    <w:b/>
                    <w:lang w:val="en-US"/>
                </w:rPr>
                <w:t>Test</w:t>
            </w:r>
```

**Observed**

The following [demo.docx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/4773415/demo.docx) file throws error on the validation while it still opens in Word and shows correctly formatted text.

**Expected**

The file should pass validation.

Events.RelatedBody: This API does nothing but forward to Clone() and has unintuitive behavior (i.e. it saves the current package and returns a new package). I'd rather remove it for now and add it back when we have something that makes more sense.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update to CodeQL v2" (#1375) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
